page.title: 05SANDWICH BAY
page.content:
{Sandwich Bay}is a sandy shore with some low dunes stabilised with{marram {grass.}Many interesting plants can be found here such as{sea holly, sea {bindweed, sea sandwort, sea rocket, {broomrape, yellow horned poppy}and several different orchids.
Near to the mouth of the{River Stour is the{Sandwich Nature Reserve}an area of dune grassland with reedbeds which was set up by the{National Trust, Kent {Trust for Nature Conservation}and the {Royal Society for the Protection of {Birds.
At low tide the sands are popular with bait diggers who catch scores of yellow tailed lug worms.
